original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dbang ngo //
translated: Buddha refers to the initiation of the five tathagatas.

original: thod pa zhes pa ni padma der gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: thod pa zhes pa ni padma der gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The skull is the lotus, and the secret consecration is there.

original: rgyud ni lus la skyob pas na rgyud do //
analyzed: rgyud ni lus la skyob pas na rgyud do //
translated: The tantra is the body, because it protects.

original: rnal 'byor ma zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs kyi sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs kyi sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The yoginī is the yoginī endowed with the samādhi of the union of wisdom and means.

original: gong na med pa zhes pa ni ngag gi lam las 'das pa'i ye shes rang rig pa der bskyed pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gong na med pa zhes pa ni ngag gi lam las 'das pa'i ye shes rang rig pa der bskyed pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The unsurpassed is the self-awareness wisdom that transcends the path of speech, and it is generated there.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: gsang ba'i yang shin tu gsang ba zhes pa la /
analyzed: gsang ba'i yang shin tu gsang ba zhes pa la /
translated: The very secret of secrets.

original: gsang ba zhes pa ni padma'o //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa ni padma'o //
translated: The secret is the lotus.

original: shin tu gsang ba zhes pa ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: shin tu gsang ba zhes pa ni rdo rje'o //
translated: The very secret is the vajra.

original: shin tu de dag gi sbyor bas bde ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu de dag gi sbyor bas bde ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: The generation of bliss is by the union of those two.

original: lha bskyed pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lha bskyed pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The generation of the deity is

original: le'u der lha bskyed de rdzogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: le'u der lha bskyed de rdzogs par byas pa'o //
translated: the completion of the generation of the deity in that chapter.

original: dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni lha rnams kyis dbang bskur ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni lha rnams kyis dbang bskur ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: The consecration is the consecration ritual of the deities.

original: le'u der de dag thams cad bshad pa de ni le'u gsum pa'o //
analyzed: le'u der de dag thams cad bshad pa de ni le'u gsum pa'o //
translated: All of that is explained in that chapter, which is the third.

original: 'o ni rdzogs pa'i don to /
analyzed: 'o ni rdzogs pa'i don to /
translated: That is the complete meaning.

original: // / da ni ri skegs kyi sbyor ba dang chu'i sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni ri skegs kyi sbyor ba dang chu'i sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the maṇḍala, etc. of the application of the peacock and the application of water should be explained.

original: de nas zhes pa ni lha bskyed pa dang / dbang bskur pa bstan pa'i rjes thogs su'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni lha bskyed pa dang / dbang bskur pa bstan pa'i rjes thogs su'o //
translated: Then, after the teaching of the generation of the deity and the conferral of initiation,

original: nor rgyas la sogs pa zhes pa ni sna tshogs sde ma'i 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i klu thams cad do //
analyzed: nor rgyas la sogs pa zhes pa ni sna tshogs sde ma'i 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i klu thams cad do //
translated: the nāgas such as Vāsuki, all of whom are summoned by the light rays of Viśvamātā,

original: phyag na rdo rje la phyag byas nas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje la phyag byas nas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni /
translated: having bowed to Vajrapāṇi, say this:

original: klu de rnams rnam pa 'di ltar smra ba'o //
analyzed: klu de rnams rnam pa 'di ltar smra ba'o //
translated: The nāgas speak in this way.
Why?

original: phyir na bdag cag rnams 'od zer gyis ni zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: phyir na bdag cag rnams 'od zer gyis ni zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: “Why are we tormented by light rays?” and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bdag cag la shod cig ces sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bdag cag la shod cig ces sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi, tell us.”

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi bdag po zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi bdag po zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, the lord of yakṣas, Vajrapāṇi,

original: gnod sbyin thams cad kyi bdag po dang gtso bo phyag na rdo rje des zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnod sbyin thams cad kyi bdag po dang gtso bo phyag na rdo rje des zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of that Vajrapāṇi, the lord and chief of all yakṣas is as follows.

original: rnal 'byor ma sna tshogs sde ma zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma sna tshogs sde ma zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the yoginī Viśākhā and so forth is as follows.

original: rgyu ci'i phyir nor rgyas la sogs pa'i klu rnams 'tshal te mchis pa lags zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu ci'i phyir nor rgyas la sogs pa'i klu rnams 'tshal te mchis pa lags zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of why do the nāgas such as Vāsuki and so forth approach is as follows.

original: de nas sna tshogs sde ma'i snying ga'i 'od zer gyis zhes pa la sogs pa ni klu rnams kyi lus kyi nang tshim par byas nas slar sna tshogs sde ma'i thugs kar zhugs pas klu thams cad 'jigs pa med par gyur pa'o /
analyzed: de nas sna tshogs sde ma'i snying ga'i 'od zer gyis zhes pa la sogs pa ni klu rnams kyi lus kyi nang tshim par byas nas slar sna tshogs sde ma'i thugs kar zhugs pas klu thams cad 'jigs pa med par gyur pa'o /
translated: Then, the meaning of the light rays from the heart of Viśākhā and so forth is as follows. Having satisfied the interior of the bodies of the nāgas, since they again enter into the heart of Viśākhā, all nāgas become fearless.

original: phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni /
translated: Having bowed down, they said this. The meaning of having bowed down is as follows.

original: lha mo la phyag 'tshal te smras pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo la phyag 'tshal te smras pa'o //
translated: They said this to the goddess.

original: lha mo bka' ni ci zhig stsol //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lha mo bka' ni ci zhig stsol // zhes pa ni /
translated: Goddess, what command do you give?

original: lha mo sna tshogs sde mas bdag cag la bka' ci stsal ba de thams cad bgyi'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: lha mo sna tshogs sde mas bdag cag la bka' ci stsal ba de thams cad bgyi'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of goddess, whatever command you give to us, we will do all of it.

original: gsungs pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma sna tshogs sde mas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma sna tshogs sde mas gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is said refers to the statement of the yoginī Viśākhā.

original: gang zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang zhig gsungs she na /
translated: What is it that is said?

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He states that:

original: mu stegs pa la sogs mkha' lding sngags //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: mu stegs pa la sogs mkha' lding sngags // zhes pa la /
translated: The mantras of the tīrthikas and so on are of the nature of garuḍas.

original: mu stegs zhes pa ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi'o //🔽mkha' lding sngags zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mu stegs zhes pa ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi'o // mkha' lding sngags zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase the tīrthikas refers to the gods such as Brahmā.

original: mkha' lding gi rang bzhin gyi sngags so //
analyzed: mkha' lding gi rang bzhin gyi sngags so //
translated: The phrase mantras of the garuḍas refers to the mantras of the nature of garuḍas.

original: ye shes las byung zhes pa ni lha de rnams kyi ye shes yang dag pa ji lta bu yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes las byung zhes pa ni lha de rnams kyi ye shes yang dag pa ji lta bu yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase arisen from wisdom means what is the true nature of the wisdom of those gods?

original: ji lta bu zhes pa ni ji lta bu'i bdag nyid yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhes pa ni ji lta bu'i bdag nyid yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase what is it like? means what is its nature?

original: dus su zin pa ji ltar yin //
analyzed: dus su zin pa ji ltar yin //
translated: How is it when seized by time?

original: zhes pa ni dus su zin pa'i rgyu sprul gyis zin pa'i 'chi'am zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dus su zin pa'i rgyu sprul gyis zin pa'i 'chi'am zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: means is it that one dies when seized by the serpent of time?

original: ji ltar dug ni skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar dug ni skye bar 'gyur //
translated: How does poison arise?

original: zhes pa ni gnas gang nas dug skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnas gang nas dug skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: means from what place does poison arise?

original: slar yang sems can 'chi 'gyur ci ;
analyzed: slar yang sems can 'chi 'gyur ci ;
translated: And again, how do sentient beings die?

original: ; zhes pa ni sbrul gyis zin pa'i sems can rnams 'chi ba'i lam du ci 'gro bar 'gyur ram zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ; zhes pa ni sbrul gyis zin pa'i sems can rnams 'chi ba'i lam du ci 'gro bar 'gyur ram zhes pa'o //
translated: This is to say, what path will those beings who are seized by the snake take to death?

original: zhus pa zhes pa ni klu rnams kyi smras pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa zhes pa ni klu rnams kyi smras pa'o //
translated: The question is what was said by the nagas.

original: khyab 'jug dbang phyug la sogs lha gang zhes pa la sogs pa la //🔽khyab 'jug ni nor lha'o //
analyzed: khyab 'jug dbang phyug la sogs lha gang zhes pa la sogs pa la // khyab 'jug ni nor lha'o //
translated: What gods, such as Vishnu, Ishvara, etc.? etc.🔽Vishnu is the god of wealth.

original: dbang phyug ni @123b zhi byed do //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni @123b zhi byed do //
translated: Ishvara is Shiva.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word etc. includes Brahma, Indra, etc.

original: lha gang zhes pa ni gang dag tshangs ris la sogs pa'i lha tshangs pa dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don la sogs pa rnams la rnam par rtog pa'i dug yod cing /
analyzed: lha gang zhes pa ni gang dag tshangs ris la sogs pa'i lha tshangs pa dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don la sogs pa rnams la rnam par rtog pa'i dug yod cing /
translated: What gods? Those gods who are in the Brahma world, etc., have the poison of conceptual thought.

original: dug gis khyab pas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug gis khyab pas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are pervaded by poison, they will die.

original: de rnams la ni 'chi 'pho mchis //
analyzed: de rnams la ni 'chi 'pho mchis //
translated: They have death.

original: zhes pa ni 'chi zhing 'gog pa'i dus kyi mthar thug pas dug gi nyes pas gnod do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'chi zhing 'gog pa'i dus kyi mthar thug pas dug gi nyes pas gnod do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: This is to say, because they have a final end in the time of death and cessation, they are harmed by the fault of poison.

original: de ltar dus su zin zhes smra //
analyzed: de ltar dus su zin zhes smra //
translated: Thus, they say, Seized by time.

original: sprul gyi dug ni sel ba med //
analyzed: sprul gyi dug ni sel ba med //
translated: The poison of a snake cannot be removed.

original: ces pa ni sprul la dug yod dam med ces pa dang / sprul gyis zin pa 'tsho'am mi 'tsho ba dbang phyug la sogs pa smra'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces pa ni sprul la dug yod dam med ces pa dang / sprul gyis zin pa 'tsho'am mi 'tsho ba dbang phyug la sogs pa smra'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one asks whether a snake has poison or not, and whether one who is bitten by a snake lives or dies, and that one asks the Lord, etc.

original: ston pa stong nyid des gsungs pa //
analyzed: ston pa stong nyid des gsungs pa //
translated: The Teacher taught emptiness.

original: zhes pa la ston pa ni khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug la sogs pa thams cad 'dul bar byed pas na ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la ston pa ni khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug la sogs pa thams cad 'dul bar byed pas na ston pa'o //
translated: The Teacher is the one who tames all, such as Vishnu and the Lord, etc.

original: stong nyid gsungs pa zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du gsungs pas na stong pa nyid du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: stong nyid gsungs pa zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du gsungs pas na stong pa nyid du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The one who taught emptiness is the one who taught all phenomena as emptiness.

original: nges pa zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi nges pa'i don nges par byed pas na /
analyzed: nges pa zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi nges pa'i don nges par byed pas na /
translated: The certain one is the one who makes certain the definitive meaning of all phenomena.

original: nges pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the certain one.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang bas gsungs zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje 'chang bas na bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang bas gsungs zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje 'chang bas na bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: The one who spoke is the one who holds the vajra of nondual wisdom.

original: chos rnams thams cad stong pa la //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad stong pa la //
translated: All things are empty.

original: zhes pa la thams cad ni phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bum pa dang ras dang shing rta la sogs pas stong pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa la thams cad ni phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bum pa dang ras dang shing rta la sogs pas stong pa de'i phyir /
translated: Here, “all” refers to the conceptualizations of things such as the five aggregates, and to the emptiness of such things as pots, cloth, and chariots.

original: sbrul gyi dug ni ji ltar yod //
analyzed: sbrul gyi dug ni ji ltar yod //
translated: How can there be the poison of a snake?

original: ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gang gis 'dzin cing gang zhig 'dzin //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin cing gang zhig 'dzin //
translated: By what is it grasped? What is grasped?

original: zhes pa ni rnam pa gang gis 'dzin cing ci zhig gzung ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam pa gang gis 'dzin cing ci zhig gzung ste /
translated: By what aspect is it grasped? What is grasped?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang 'dzin pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir dug gi rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang 'dzin pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir dug gi rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: Since the grasped, the grasper, and the act of grasping are not perceived, there is no conceptualization of the poison.

original: ji ltar spyod ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: ji ltar spyod ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: How does one behave? The meaning is easy to understand.

original: 'dod chags gti mug stong pa nyid //🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags gti mug stong pa nyid // ces pa ni /
translated: Attachment, aversion, and ignorance are emptiness.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug stong pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug stong pa'o //
translated: Attachment, aversion, and ignorance are empty.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum po de rnams dug nyid du gyur pa de rnams kyang stong na dug ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum po de rnams dug nyid du gyur pa de rnams kyang stong na dug ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that if those three—desire, hatred, and ignorance—are empty, how can poison arise?

original: grangs chen zhes pa ni sna tshogs sde ma la bod pa'o //
analyzed: grangs chen zhes pa ni sna tshogs sde ma la bod pa'o //
translated: “Many” refers to the various types of poison.

original: yul ni @124a * //
analyzed: yul ni @124a * //
translated: “Object”

original: stong pa nyid ces pa la yul ni phung po lnga'i lus de nyid stong pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces pa la yul ni phung po lnga'i lus de nyid stong pa'o //
translated: refers to the emptiness of the body of the five aggregates.

original: yul gyis nyes pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yul gyis nyes pa zhes pa ni /
translated: “The fault of the object”

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa stong pa yin na dug gi nyes pa ji ltar yod /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa stong pa yin na dug gi nyes pa ji ltar yod /
translated: means that if the object, the sense faculty, and the consciousness are empty, how can there be the fault of poison?🔽“Poison”

original: dug ces pa ni sems kyi rnam par rtog pa nyid dug ste /
analyzed: dug ces pa ni sems kyi rnam par rtog pa nyid dug ste /
translated: means that the poison is the conceptualization of the mind.

original: gal te sems kyi rnam par rtog pa yod na /
analyzed: gal te sems kyi rnam par rtog pa yod na /
translated: If there is conceptualization of the mind,

original: de'i tshe dug yod la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral na dug med ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe dug yod la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral na dug med ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: then there is poison. The meaning is that if there is no conceptualization of the mind, there is no poison.

original: lha rnams yul rnams kyis ni bsgribs //
analyzed: lha rnams yul rnams kyis ni bsgribs //
translated: The gods are obscured by objects.

original: zhes pa la lha gang dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i dra bas dkris pa de rnams kyi dug ni yul gyi nyes pa'i dug ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa la lha gang dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i dra bas dkris pa de rnams kyi dug ni yul gyi nyes pa'i dug ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The poison of those who are bound by the net of discursive thought is the poison of the fault of the object.🔽The purification of the fault of the object

original: yul gyi nyes pa sbyangs pa nyid //
analyzed: yul gyi nyes pa sbyangs pa nyid //
translated: is the purification of the fault of the object by the thought of the deity.

original: ces pa ni gang dag gis yul gyi nyes pa lha'i rnam pas yang dag par sbyor ba de la yul gyi nyes pas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces pa ni gang dag gis yul gyi nyes pa lha'i rnam pas yang dag par sbyor ba de la yul gyi nyes pas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The fault of the object does not stain him who is engaged in the purification of the fault of the object by the thought of the deity.

original: ston pa longs spyod gos mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ston pa longs spyod gos mi 'gyur //
translated: The teacher is not stained by enjoyment.

original: zhes pa la ston pa la ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la ston pa la ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: The teacher is the Lord Vajradhara.

original: longs spyod gos mi 'gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: longs spyod gos mi 'gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: He is not stained by enjoyment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga longs spyod kyang mi gos shing gos par mi 'gyur ro //🔽ri skegs sbyor ba zhes pa ni //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga longs spyod kyang mi gos shing gos par mi 'gyur ro // ri skegs sbyor ba zhes pa ni //
translated: He is not stained by enjoyment, even though he enjoys the five sense objects such as form.🔽The method of the parrot

original: ri skegs kyi sbyor bas dug nyams par byed pa 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri skegs kyi sbyor bas dug nyams par byed pa 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the method of the parrot for destroying poison, which will be explained below.🔽All the nagas, etc.

original: klu rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: klu rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: is easy to understand.

original: dus zin the tshom med par ni //
analyzed: dus zin the tshom med par ni //
translated: The time has come, there is no doubt.

original: zhes pa ni khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'o //
translated: This refers to Vishnu, Shiva, and so forth.

original: lha rnams dus su zin pa la the tshom med cing gdon mi za zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lha rnams dus su zin pa la the tshom med cing gdon mi za zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The gods are not doubtful about the time having come, it is certain.

original: 'di ltar smras te zhes pa ni klu thams cad kyis 'di lta bur smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar smras te zhes pa ni klu thams cad kyis 'di lta bur smras te /
translated: Thus it was said means that all the nagas said this.

original: rang rang gi gnas su song zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang rang gi gnas su song zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means go to your own places.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das mas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das mas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then the Blessed Lady and so forth.

original: de nas zhes pa ni klu'i tshig gi rjes thogs su bcom ldan 'das ma sna tshogs sde mas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni klu'i tshig gi rjes thogs su bcom ldan 'das ma sna tshogs sde mas so //
translated: Then means after the words of the nagas, the Blessed Lady Various-Army.

original: yul gyi nyes pa zhes pa ni yul la sogs pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i don du sngags gsungs pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: yul gyi nyes pa zhes pa ni yul la sogs pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i don du sngags gsungs pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the faults of the country is that the mantra was spoken for the purpose of abandoning the faults of the country and so forth.

original: sngags gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sngags gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the mantra?

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: It is stated:

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'ako& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'ako& ham /
translated: Om shunyata jnana vajra svabhava atmako 'ham.

original: 'dis yul thams cad kyi nyes pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis yul thams cad kyi nyes pa spong bar byed do //
translated: This abandons all the faults of the country.

original: sngags 'di bshad pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: sngags 'di bshad pa gsungs pa //
translated: He taught this mantra.

original: stong dang stong min zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la stong pa ma yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: stong dang stong min zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la stong pa ma yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: As for empty and not empty, there is emptiness that is not empty.

original: de nyid snying rje'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid snying rje'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That is the nature of compassion.

original: @124b mtha' dag ces pa ni 'bras bu mtha' dag go //
analyzed: @124b mtha' dag ces pa ni 'bras bu mtha' dag go //
translated: As for all, it refers to all effects.

original: bcas zhes pa ni dngos po mtha' dag dang thabs cig pa'o //
analyzed: bcas zhes pa ni dngos po mtha' dag dang thabs cig pa'o //
translated: As for together, it refers to all things together with the means.

original: sgyu ma rmi lam lta bur gcig / ces pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i stong pa nyid dang rmi lam lta bu'i stong pa nyid de sgyu ma dang rmi lam dag dang stong pa nyid gcig tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma rmi lam lta bur gcig / ces pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i stong pa nyid dang rmi lam lta bu'i stong pa nyid de sgyu ma dang rmi lam dag dang stong pa nyid gcig tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the emptiness that is like an illusion and the emptiness that is like a dream as being the same as the illusion and the dream.

original: 'jig rten mtha' dag brdzun gyis bcings //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' dag brdzun gyis bcings //
translated: All worlds are bound by falsehood.

original: zhes pa ni log pa'i shes pas 'jig rten mtha' dag bcings pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni log pa'i shes pas 'jig rten mtha' dag bcings pa'o //
translated: This means that all worlds are bound by false cognition.

original: kye lags bshes mo 'di ltar ltos //🔽zhes pa la //
analyzed: kye lags bshes mo 'di ltar ltos // zhes pa la //
translated: Oh my friend, look at this!

original: kye lags zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: kye lags zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: As for oh my, it is an exclamation.

original: bshes mo zhes pa ni grogs mo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bshes mo zhes pa ni grogs mo zhes pa'o //
translated: As for friend, it means companion.

original: 'di ltar ltos zhes pa ni 'di ltar bur ltos shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ltos zhes pa ni 'di ltar bur ltos shig pa'o //
translated: Thus, look means look in this way.

original: rnal 'byor ma grogs mo thams cad 'di lta bu'i stong pa la ltos shig pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma grogs mo thams cad 'di lta bu'i stong pa la ltos shig pa'o //
translated: All the yoginī friends should look at emptiness in this way.

original: de nas zhes pa ni yul gyi nyes pa spong ba bstan pa'i rjes thogs su'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni yul gyi nyes pa spong ba bstan pa'i rjes thogs su'o //
translated: Then means after the teaching of the abandonment of the faults of the object.

original: da ni ri skegs bsgrub pa'i don du mkha' lding gi dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ri skegs bsgrub pa'i don du mkha' lding gi dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to accomplish the garuḍa, in order to teach the maṇḍala of the consecration of the garuḍa,

original: phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das ma'i zhabs la spyi bos gtugs te 'di skad ces gsol te zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma sna tshogs sde ma'i zhabs kyi padma'i rdul la phyag na rdo rjes phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces smras zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das ma'i zhabs la spyi bos gtugs te 'di skad ces gsol te zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma sna tshogs sde ma'i zhabs kyi padma'i rdul la phyag na rdo rjes phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces smras zhes pa'i don to //
translated: it is said that Vajrapāṇi bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed Lady and said this: Vajrapāṇi bowed to the dust of the lotus feet of the Blessed Viśvamātā and said this.

original: ri skegs sbyor ba rab rnyed dka' //
analyzed: ri skegs sbyor ba rab rnyed dka' //
translated: The union of the garuḍa is very difficult to attain.

original: lha mo yis ni bshad du gsol //
analyzed: lha mo yis ni bshad du gsol //
translated: Please explain it, O Goddess.

original: zhes pa ni kye lha mo sna tshogs sde ma ri skegs kyi sbyor bas dug nyams par byed pa bdag la bshad du gsol //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kye lha mo sna tshogs sde ma ri skegs kyi sbyor bas dug nyams par byed pa bdag la bshad du gsol //
translated: Thus, O Goddess, please explain to me the method of destroying poison by the means of the parrot.

original: gsungs pa zhes pa ni sna tshogs sde mas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa zhes pa ni sna tshogs sde mas gsungs pa'o //
translated: The statement she said is the statement of the Goddess.

original: dkyil 'khor med par sbyin mi bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor med par sbyin mi bya //
translated: One should not give without a maṇḍala.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor med par ri skegs kyi sbyor ba rjes su sbyin par mi bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor med par ri skegs kyi sbyor ba rjes su sbyin par mi bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means one should not give the means of the parrot without a maṇḍala.

original: slob ma bsdu bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma bsdu bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not gather disciples.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor med par slob ma bsdu bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor med par slob ma bsdu bar mi bya'o //
translated: This means one should not gather disciples without a maṇḍala.

original: slob ma bsdu ba'i don du lha mo'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob ma bsdu ba'i don du lha mo'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: For the purpose of gathering disciples, the maṇḍala of the Goddess is taught:

original: gtso bos ji skad gsungs pa yi //
analyzed: gtso bos ji skad gsungs pa yi //
translated: As stated by the principal one.

original: zhes pa ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad par bya yis dkyil 'khor de nyon zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad par bya yis dkyil 'khor de nyon zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means listen to that maṇḍala as taught by the previous Tathāgatas, I will explain it.

original: mtho lnga pa yis gzung ste /
analyzed: mtho lnga pa yis gzung ste /
translated: One should take it with five cubits.

original: zhes pa ni yul lnga rnam par dag pa'i don du mtho lnga pa'i sa tsam bzung ste /🔽dug gi dkyil 'khor gyo don du mtho lnga pa'i sa @125a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yul lnga rnam par dag pa'i don du mtho lnga pa'i sa tsam bzung ste / dug gi dkyil 'khor gyo don du mtho lnga pa'i sa @125a * //
translated: This is the meaning of the five pure objects.🔽One should take the ground to a height of five cubits for the mandala of poison.

original: gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should take the ground to a height of five cubits for the mandala of poison.

original: khor yug tu ni gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: khor yug tu ni gru bzhi'o //
translated: It is square on all sides.

original: zhes pa ni kun nas gru bzhi par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun nas gru bzhi par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it should be square on all sides.

original: de yi phyed kyi zlum po la //
analyzed: de yi phyed kyi zlum po la //
translated: Half of that is a circle.

original: zhes pa ni gru bzhi lham pa'i phyed las zlum por bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gru bzhi lham pa'i phyed las zlum por bya'o //
translated: This means that one should make a circle from half of the square.

original: brgyad las 'dam skyes 'dab ma brgyad //
analyzed: brgyad las 'dam skyes 'dab ma brgyad //
translated: In the eight directions, an eight-petaled lotus.

original: ces pa ni zlum po'i phyogs brgyad dang de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bri bar bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //🔽aom h'um zhes pa nas aa dhishtha ye ta zhes pa'i bar gyi sngags ni sa sbyang ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: ces pa ni zlum po'i phyogs brgyad dang de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bri bar bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go // aom h'um zhes pa nas aa dhishtha ye ta zhes pa'i bar gyi sngags ni sa sbyang ba'i sngags so //
translated: This means that one should draw an eight-petaled lotus in the eight directions of the circle and in the center.🔽The mantra from Oṃ hūṃ up to adhiṣṭhāyeda is the mantra for purifying the ground.

original: aom he ru ka badzra zhes pa la sogs pa ni gtor ma'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom he ru ka badzra zhes pa la sogs pa ni gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra from Oṃ heruka vajra up to the bali mantra is the bali mantra.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi mthar tha tha gnyis ni phat phat gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi mthar tha tha gnyis ni phat phat gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Oṃ sarvatathāgata etc. At the end of the mantra, the two tha tha are the two phaṭ.

original: sngags 'dis lan bdun du thig skud la mngon par bsngags par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'dis lan bdun du thig skud la mngon par bsngags par bya'o //
translated: With this mantra, the thread should be empowered seven times.

original: thig skud kyi sngags so //
analyzed: thig skud kyi sngags so //
translated: The mantra of the thread.

original: gru bzhi pa zhes pa la sogs pa la sgo bzhi dang rta babs bzhi dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa zhes pa la sogs pa la sgo bzhi dang rta babs bzhi dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: In the square etc. means that the maṇḍala should be measured with four doors and four pediments.

original: kha khyer snam bu spangs pa la //
analyzed: kha khyer snam bu spangs pa la //
translated: Without a ledge and a platform,

original: zhes pa ni khyer gru bzhi pa'i nang du snam bu ste gzungs kyi snam bu spangs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khyer gru bzhi pa'i nang du snam bu ste gzungs kyi snam bu spangs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means that the maṇḍala is without a ledge, that is, without a platform for the dhāraṇī.

original: sangs rgyas thod pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thod pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of Buddhakapāla,

original: zhes pa ni he ru ka dang sna tshogs sde ma'i rnal 'byor bya zhes pa'i don to //🔽rdul tshon gzhan dang 'dres med pa'i //
analyzed: zhes pa ni he ru ka dang sna tshogs sde ma'i rnal 'byor bya zhes pa'i don to // rdul tshon gzhan dang 'dres med pa'i //
translated: means that one should perform the yoga of Heruka and Viśva.🔽Not mixed with other colored powders,

original: zhes pa ni rdul tshon gzhan dang 'dres par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdul tshon gzhan dang 'dres par mi bya'o //
translated: means that one should not mix with other colored powders.

original: rdul tshon dmar pos rdzogs par bya //
analyzed: rdul tshon dmar pos rdzogs par bya //
translated: One should complete it with red sand.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor ma lus pa kha dog dmar po'i rdul tshon gyis bri bar bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor ma lus pa kha dog dmar po'i rdul tshon gyis bri bar bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one should draw all the maṇḍalas with red sand.

original: der ni bum pa bzhi po rnams//
analyzed: der ni bum pa bzhi po rnams//
translated: There, the four vases

original: zhes pa ni lha mo bzhi rnam par dag pa'i bum pa bzhi po rnams bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha mo bzhi rnam par dag pa'i bum pa bzhi po rnams bya'o //
translated: are the four vases purified by the four goddesses.

original: bum par mtshan ma bri bya ba //
analyzed: bum par mtshan ma bri bya ba //
translated: One should draw the signs in the vases.

original: zhes pa ni dang po'i bum pa la thod pa /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dang po'i bum pa la thod pa /
translated: In the first vase, one should draw a skull-cup.

original: gnyis pa la kha tv'a ga /
analyzed: gnyis pa la kha tv'a ga /
translated: In the second, a khaṭvāṅga.

original: gsum pa la gri gug / bzhi pa la cang te'u /
analyzed: gsum pa la gri gug / bzhi pa la cang te'u /
translated: In the third, a flaying knife. In the fourth, a small drum.

original: las thams cad pa'i bum pa la cang te'u //
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i bum pa la cang te'u //
translated: In the vase of all activities, a small drum.

original: steng du rdo rje'o //
analyzed: steng du rdo rje'o //
translated: Above, a vajra.

original: de ltar bum pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar bum pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Thus, the vases and so forth are easy to understand.

original: 'bru lnga zhes pa ni sran ma ma sha dang nas dang gro dang sngon dang til te bum pa rnams su gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bru lnga zhes pa ni sran ma ma sha dang nas dang gro dang sngon dang til te bum pa rnams su gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The five grains are beans, barley, wheat, peas, and sesame seeds. They should be placed in the vases.

original: de nas 'o ma'i snod ces pa ni bum pa'i steng du 'o ma'i snod sbyang gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'o ma'i snod ces pa ni bum pa'i steng du 'o ma'i snod sbyang gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, the vessel of milk is a vessel of milk that should be placed above the vases.

original: dang po stong pa nyid du bsgoms la pam yongs su @125b gyur pa las padma'o //
analyzed: dang po stong pa nyid du bsgoms la pam yongs su @125b gyur pa las padma'o //
translated: First, having meditated on emptiness, from a completely transformed paṃ, there is a lotus.

original: der h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'o //
analyzed: der h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'o //
translated: In that, from a completely transformed hūṃ, there is a vajra.

original: yang rdo rje'i lte bar h'um ngo //
analyzed: yang rdo rje'i lte bar h'um ngo //
translated: Again, in the center of the vajra, there is a hūṃ.

original: rdo rje dang h'um gyur pa las he ru ka sku mdog sngon po zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa g-yas na gri gug dang thod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang h'um gyur pa las he ru ka sku mdog sngon po zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa g-yas na gri gug dang thod pa'o //
translated: From the vajra and hūṃ, there is a blue Heruka with one face and four arms, holding a flaying knife and skull cup in the right hands

original: g-yon na kha tv'am ga dang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: g-yon na kha tv'am ga dang rdo rje'o //
translated: and a khaṭvāṅga and vajra in the left hands.

original: sku la mi'i rus pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: sku la mi'i rus pas brgyan pa /
translated: His body is adorned with human bone ornaments.

original: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis gnas pa /
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis gnas pa /
translated: He stands in half-dance posture.

original: gcer bu'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: gcer bu'i rang bzhin can /
translated: He is naked.

original: zhal gyi mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa /
analyzed: zhal gyi mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa /
translated: His mouth bares fangs slightly.

original: skra ser po gyen du 'bar ba /
analyzed: skra ser po gyen du 'bar ba /
translated: His yellow hair swirls upward.🔽He is adorned with a head ornament of five dry skulls.

original: dbul la thod pas brgyan pa /🔽sna tshogs sde mas 'khyud pa'i dpa' bo de ltar bsam par bya zhing //
analyzed: dbul la thod pas brgyan pa / sna tshogs sde mas 'khyud pa'i dpa' bo de ltar bsam par bya zhing //
translated: He is embraced by a variegated goddess.

original: rnal 'byor 'di dag slob dpon gyis bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di dag slob dpon gyis bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This yoga is to be performed by the master.

original: sa 'og bdun ni 'khrug par byed //
analyzed: sa 'og bdun ni 'khrug par byed //
translated: The seven lower realms are agitated.

original: ces pa ni sa rim pa bdun na gnas pa'i klu rnams 'khrug par byed pas na sa 'og bdun 'khrug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni sa rim pa bdun na gnas pa'i klu rnams 'khrug par byed pas na sa 'og bdun 'khrug par byed pa ste /
translated: This is the one who agitates the nagas dwelling in the seven levels of the earth, and so she is the one who agitates the seven underworlds.

original: bcom ldan 'das he ru ka dpa' bo'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das he ru ka dpa' bo'o //
translated: The Bhagavat is the hero Heruka.

original: aom h'um kham sva zhes pa ni shar gyi 'dab ma la aom gyur pa las sna tshogs sde ma'o //
analyzed: aom h'um kham sva zhes pa ni shar gyi 'dab ma la aom gyur pa las sna tshogs sde ma'o //
translated: Om, hum, kham, svam: on the eastern petal, from om comes Visakha,

original: lhor h'um gyur pa las 'dod can ma'o //
analyzed: lhor h'um gyur pa las 'dod can ma'o //
translated: from hum in the south comes Kamadava,

original: nub tu kham gyur pa las sa 'og gnas ma'o //
analyzed: nub tu kham gyur pa las sa 'og gnas ma'o //
translated: from kham in the west comes Patalasthita,

original: byang du sva gyur pa las rab tu bzang mo'o //
analyzed: byang du sva gyur pa las rab tu bzang mo'o //
translated: and from svam in the north comes Subhadra.

original: rnal 'byor ma 'di rnams ni zhal gcig phyag bzhi ma ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma 'di rnams ni zhal gcig phyag bzhi ma ste /
translated: These yoginis have one face and four arms.

original: rnal 'byor ma 'di dag gi g-yas na gri gug dang thod pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma 'di dag gi g-yas na gri gug dang thod pa'o //
translated: In the right hands of these yoginis are curved knives and skulls,

original: g-yon na kha tv'am ga dang cang te'u'o //
analyzed: g-yon na kha tv'am ga dang cang te'u'o //
translated: and in the left hands are khaṭvāṇgas and damarus.

original: rus rgyan zhes pa sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: rus rgyan zhes pa sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The bone ornaments and so forth are easy to understand.

original: blo ldan mtshams kyi 'dab bsam pa /
analyzed: blo ldan mtshams kyi 'dab bsam pa /
translated: The wise one should visualize the petals in the intermediate directions.

original: zhes pa la mtshams kyi 'dab ma la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma thams cad ni chang 'tshong ma dang / 'byung po ma dang / bzhin bzangs ma dang / nam mkha' 'gro ma ste rnal 'byor ma 'di dag thams cad h'um gyur pa las bzhengs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la mtshams kyi 'dab ma la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma thams cad ni chang 'tshong ma dang / 'byung po ma dang / bzhin bzangs ma dang / nam mkha' 'gro ma ste rnal 'byor ma 'di dag thams cad h'um gyur pa las bzhengs pa'o //
translated: The yoginis who stand on the intermediate petals are the barmaid, the bhutāni, the beautiful-faced one, and the sky-goer. All these yoginis arise from the syllable hūṃ.

original: shar gyi 'dab ma la sogs pa na gnas pa'i lha mo thams cad ni mdog sngon mo'o //
analyzed: shar gyi 'dab ma la sogs pa na gnas pa'i lha mo thams cad ni mdog sngon mo'o //
translated: All the goddesses who stand on the eastern petal and so forth are blue.

original: mtshams kyi 'dab ma'i lha mo thams cad ni mdog ser mo'o //🔽lha mo mdog sngon mo rnams ni gos sngon mo mnabs so //
analyzed: mtshams kyi 'dab ma'i lha mo thams cad ni mdog ser mo'o // lha mo mdog sngon mo rnams ni gos sngon mo mnabs so //
translated: All the goddesses who stand on the intermediate petals are yellow.🔽The blue goddesses wear blue garments.

original: lha mo mdog ser mo rnams ni gos ser mo mnabs so //
analyzed: lha mo mdog ser mo rnams ni gos ser mo mnabs so //
translated: The yellow goddesses wear yellow garments.

original: rnal 'byor ma thams cad ni g-yas brkyang pa'i zhabs kyis ba zhugs pa'o //🔽phyogs kyi 'dab ma la gnas pa'i mtshan ma ji lta ba bzhin du @126a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma thams cad ni g-yas brkyang pa'i zhabs kyis ba zhugs pa'o // phyogs kyi 'dab ma la gnas pa'i mtshan ma ji lta ba bzhin du @126a * //
translated: All the yoginis stand in the posture of right leg drawn in.🔽The signs that stand on the cardinal petals are as before.

original: mtshams kyi 'dab ma la gnas pa'i mtshan ma yang de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi 'dab ma la gnas pa'i mtshan ma yang de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The signs that stand on the intermediate petals are the same.

original: klu brgyad brgyan byas lha mo 'di //
analyzed: klu brgyad brgyan byas lha mo 'di //
translated: This goddess is adorned with the eight nāgas.

original: zhes pa ni nor rgyas la sogs pa'i klu brgyad kyis rnal 'byor ma brgyad brgyan par byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nor rgyas la sogs pa'i klu brgyad kyis rnal 'byor ma brgyad brgyan par byas pa'o //
translated: This means that the eight yoginīs are adorned with the eight nāgas, beginning with Vāsuki.

original: g-yas na gri gug ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: g-yas na gri gug ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The line “In her right hand a flaying knife” and so forth is easy to understand.

original: de nas rang gi snying ga'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spyan drangs te dkyil 'khor la gzhug par bya /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying ga'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spyan drangs te dkyil 'khor la gzhug par bya /
translated: Then, with light rays from one’s heart, the tathāgatas are invited and placed in the maṇḍala.

original: phyis ni gtor ma gtang bar bya //
analyzed: phyis ni gtor ma gtang bar bya //
translated: After that, one should offer the bali.

original: zhes pa ni de nas slob dpon gyis klu la 'o ma'i gtor ma sbyin par bya zhing bdag nyid chang btung bar bya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de nas slob dpon gyis klu la 'o ma'i gtor ma sbyin par bya zhing bdag nyid chang btung bar bya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This means that the master should offer a milk bali to the nāgas and should drink beer himself.

original: sangs rgyas thod pa'i sbyor ldan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thod pa'i sbyor ldan pa //
translated: One should be endowed with the union of Buddhakapāla.

original: zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained.

original: mar me bzhi ni dbul bar bya //
analyzed: mar me bzhi ni dbul bar bya //
translated: One should offer four lamps.

original: zhes pa ni sbrang rtsi'i mar me dang / zhun mar gyi mar me dang / nya'i zhag gi mar me dang / dri zhim po'i mar khu'i mar ma ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sbrang rtsi'i mar me dang / zhun mar gyi mar me dang / nya'i zhag gi mar me dang / dri zhim po'i mar khu'i mar ma ste /
translated: This means that one should offer a lamp of honey, a lamp of ghee, a lamp of fish oil, and a lamp of fragrant oil.

original: de ltar mar me bzhi dbul bar bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar mar me bzhi dbul bar bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, one should offer the four lamps.

original: 'bras bu bzhi yang dbul bar bya //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi yang dbul bar bya //
translated: One should also offer the four fruits.

original: zhes pa ni aa mra'i 'bras bu dang / na ri ke'i 'bras bu dang / chu shing gi 'bras bu dang / ka pi tha'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni aa mra'i 'bras bu dang / na ri ke'i 'bras bu dang / chu shing gi 'bras bu dang / ka pi tha'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The four fruits are the mango fruit, the coconut fruit, the banana fruit, and the grape fruit.

original: 'bras bu bzhi po 'di dag dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi po 'di dag dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer these four fruits.

original: de nas slob ma zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas slob ma zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Then, the disciple, etc. is easy to understand.

original: gdan bzhugs te zhes pa ni slob dpon gdan la bzhugs pa la /
analyzed: gdan bzhugs te zhes pa ni slob dpon gdan la bzhugs pa la /
translated: Seated on the seat, the master sits on the seat.

original: slob mas ri skegs kyi sbyor ba bsgrub pa'i don du gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: slob mas ri skegs kyi sbyor ba bsgrub pa'i don du gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: The disciple should make a request for the sake of accomplishing the parrot practice.

original: ston pa bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas bla ma che zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs bcad do ;🔽; de nas slob dpon brtse ba yis //
analyzed: ston pa bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas bla ma che zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs bcad do ; ; de nas slob dpon brtse ba yis //
translated: The teacher, Bhagavat, etc. up to great guru is the verse of request.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, the master, with love, etc.

original: slob ma lhag par gnas pa'i dus su so shing sbyin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: slob ma lhag par gnas pa'i dus su so shing sbyin par bya ba'o //
translated: At the time of the disciple's preparatory rite, one should give the tooth stick.

original: khrag 'thung go 'phang gnas pa yi //
analyzed: khrag 'thung go 'phang gnas pa yi //
translated: The state of a blood-drinker is maintained.

original: zhes pa ni slob ma he ru ka'i gzugs su gnas par bsam par bya zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob ma he ru ka'i gzugs su gnas par bsam par bya zhes sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be applied to the thought that the disciple remains in the form of Heruka.

original: so shing gi sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: so shing gi sngags gsungs pa /
translated: The mantra for the tooth-stick is stated:

original: aom h'um he zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis so shing sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: aom h'um he zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis so shing sbyin par bya'o //
translated: With the mantra Om hum he... the tooth-stick is given.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //🔽mgrin pa lag par zla ba bsam //🔽zhes pa ni mgrin pa dang / lag pa dag tu aa la sogs pa gyur ba las //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o // mgrin pa lag par zla ba bsam // zhes pa ni mgrin pa dang / lag pa dag tu aa la sogs pa gyur ba las //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsam par bya //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsam par bya //
translated: The moon is thought to be in the throat and in the hand.

original: zhes pa'i tha @126b tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tha @126b tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the words:🔽In the throat and in the hands, the moon-disk is thought to be from the transformation of the a and so forth.

original: mgrin par srung skud bcing bar bya zhing lag par me tog bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: mgrin par srung skud bcing bar bya zhing lag par me tog bcing bar bya'o //
translated: The protection cord is tied on the throat and the flower is tied on the hand.

original: zla ba'i zer zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i zer zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The words rays of the moon and so forth are easy to understand.

original: slob ma'i mgor ni lag bzhag ste //
analyzed: slob ma'i mgor ni lag bzhag ste //
translated: Placing the hand on the head of the disciple,🔽this is the meaning of the words:

original: zhes pa ni slob ma'i mgo la lag pa bzhag ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags lan bdun du gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob ma'i mgo la lag pa bzhag ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags lan bdun du gdon par bya'o //
translated: Placing the hand on the head of the disciple, the mantra to be explained is recited seven times.

original: des ni slob ma lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni slob ma lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the disciple will be especially consecrated.

original: sngags gsungs pa /🔽aom sarba buddha zhes pa la sogs pa nas ha ha zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'i sngags gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags gsungs pa / aom sarba buddha zhes pa la sogs pa nas ha ha zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'i sngags gdon par bya'o //
translated: The mantra is stated:🔽Oṃ sarva buddha bodhisatva ākāśa gagana samatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako 'ham.

original: sngags 'dis sangs rgyas thams cad slob ma'i lus la byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
analyzed: sngags 'dis sangs rgyas thams cad slob ma'i lus la byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
translated: With this mantra, all the buddhas consecrate the body of the disciple.

original: lhag par gnas pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: lhag par gnas pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: By the mere consecration,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: and so forth is easy to understand.

original: bdag nyid chen po grags chen po //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po grags chen po //
translated: The great being of great fame,

original: bum par zhugs pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: bum par zhugs pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: by merely entering the vase,

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad dang ldan pa'i he ru ka bum pa'i nang du zhu bar gyur bar bsam par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad dang ldan pa'i he ru ka bum pa'i nang du zhu bar gyur bar bsam par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that one should imagine Heruka, endowed with the eight yoginīs, melting inside the vase.

original: dung phor chus bkang ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dung phor chus bkang ste zhes pa ni /
translated: The meaning of filled with water in a conch shell is

original: dung phor gyi chu la he ru ka bdag nyid zhu bas /
analyzed: dung phor gyi chu la he ru ka bdag nyid zhu bas /
translated: that the water in the conch shell melts into Heruka.

original: dung por byin gyis brlab par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dung por byin gyis brlab par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should consecrate the conch shell.

original: man gzhi zhes pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: man gzhi zhes pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of base is easy to understand.

original: chus gtor te zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgor slob ma la chus gtor bar bya ste /
analyzed: chus gtor te zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgor slob ma la chus gtor bar bya ste /
translated: The phrase having sprinkled with water means that one should sprinkle water on the disciple at the door of the maṇḍala.

original: aom aa bhi shinytsa tu zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis cod pan la gtor ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: aom aa bhi shinytsa tu zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis cod pan la gtor ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: One should sprinkle the crown with the mantra Oṃ abhiṣiñcatu and so forth.

original: mig ras bsal te zhes pa ni mig gi ras phye ste /
analyzed: mig ras bsal te zhes pa ni mig gi ras phye ste /
translated: The phrase having removed the blindfold means that one should remove the blindfold from the eyes.

original: dkyil 'khor mchod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mchod par bya ba'o //
translated: One should worship the maṇḍala.

original: aom he ru ka badzra pushpa pra t'itstsha h'um zhes pa ni he ru ka la me tog 'bul ba'o //🔽rim pa 'dis sna tshogs sde ma nas brtsams te /
analyzed: aom he ru ka badzra pushpa pra t'itstsha h'um zhes pa ni he ru ka la me tog 'bul ba'o // rim pa 'dis sna tshogs sde ma nas brtsams te /
translated: The phrase Oṃ heruka vajra puṣpe pūja means offering flowers to Heruka.

original: ji srid nam mkhar gnas pa'i mthar thug pa la me tog dbul ba'o //
analyzed: ji srid nam mkhar gnas pa'i mthar thug pa la me tog dbul ba'o //
translated: By this process, one should offer flowers to the deities beginning with Viśva and ending with those abiding in space.

original: slob ma la bstan par bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: slob ma la bstan par bya zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase one should show the disciple means

original: slob ma la dkyil 'khor dang lha'i ming dang mtshan ma thams cad bstan par bya ba'o //🔽dung phor blangs te chu btung bya //
analyzed: slob ma la dkyil 'khor dang lha'i ming dang mtshan ma thams cad bstan par bya ba'o // dung phor blangs te chu btung bya //
translated: that one should show the disciple the maṇḍala and the names and signs of all the deities.🔽One should drink water from the conch.

original: zhes pa ni dung phor chu dang bcas pa lag pa gnyis kyis yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dung phor chu dang bcas pa lag pa gnyis kyis yang dag par blangs te /
translated: means that one should take up with both hands the conch filled with water and drink it.

original: dkyil 'khor ba'i sngags bton cing //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba'i sngags bton cing //
translated: Reciting the mantra of the maṇḍala,

original: he ru ka'i sngags kyis dud phor gyi chu slob ma'i khal sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: he ru ka'i sngags kyis dud phor gyi chu slob ma'i khal sbyin par bya'o //
translated: and with the mantra of Heruka, one should give the water of the conch to the disciple.

original: de'i yon tan gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i yon tan gsungs pa //
translated: Its qualities are stated:

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dug thams cad @127a * //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dug thams cad @127a * //
translated: All poisons, whether fixed or moving,🔽will not arise in his body.

original: de'i lus la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i lus la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they will not arise in his body.

original: brtan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //🔽ji srid mkha' lding rig yod par //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o // ji srid mkha' lding rig yod par //
translated: “Fixed” and so forth are easy to understand.🔽As long as the knowledge of Garuḍa exists,

original: zhes pa ni nam mkha' lding gi rig pa ji srid grub par bya ba med pa'i dus de srid du /
analyzed: zhes pa ni nam mkha' lding gi rig pa ji srid grub par bya ba med pa'i dus de srid du /
translated: as long as the knowledge of Garuḍa is not accomplished, for that long

original: nam mkha' lding gi sbyor ba mi bya'o //🔽sangs rgyas thod pa'i rnal 'byor bas //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi sbyor ba mi bya'o // sangs rgyas thod pa'i rnal 'byor bas //
translated: one should not perform the practice of Garuḍa.🔽As long as the practice of Buddhakapāla exists,

original: zhes pa ni ji srid du nam mkha' lding gi rig pa grub pa'i dus de srid du ni sangs rgyas thod pa'i sbyor bas bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji srid du nam mkha' lding gi rig pa grub pa'i dus de srid du ni sangs rgyas thod pa'i sbyor bas bya ba'o //
translated: for as long as the knowledge of Garuḍa is accomplished, for that long one should perform the practice of Buddhakapāla.

original: 'bad rtsol bya ba min zhes pa ni ji srid du ma grub pa de srid dus su zin pa po'o drung du 'gro ba'i rtsol ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol bya ba min zhes pa ni ji srid du ma grub pa de srid dus su zin pa po'o drung du 'gro ba'i rtsol ba mi bya'o //
translated: The line one should not make an effort means that as long as one has not achieved the goal, one should not make an effort to go before the master of the rite.

original: dus zin 'chi ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dus zin 'chi ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The line when the time has come, death and so forth is easy to understand.

original: ngo mtshar bstan zhes pa ni grub nas ngo mtshar bstan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ngo mtshar bstan zhes pa ni grub nas ngo mtshar bstan par bya ba ste /
translated: The line one should show amazement means that after one has achieved the goal, one should show amazement.

original: ri skegs kyi sbyor ba'i ngo mtshar bstan pa'o //🔽sa la ma lhung ba'i lci ba blangs te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ri skegs kyi sbyor ba'i ngo mtshar bstan pa'o // sa la ma lhung ba'i lci ba blangs te zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the showing of amazement at the application of the parrot.🔽 The line one should take up the clay that has not fallen to the ground means

original: ba ser skya'i lci ba sa la ltung bar ma gyur pa par snang nas blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba ser skya'i lci ba sa la ltung bar ma gyur pa par snang nas blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: that one should take up the clay of a yellow cow that has not fallen to the ground.

original: ri skegs gnyis bya zhing zhes pa ni lci ba de las ri skegs gnyis bya'o //
analyzed: ri skegs gnyis bya zhing zhes pa ni lci ba de las ri skegs gnyis bya'o //
translated: The line one should make two parrots means that one should make two parrots from that clay.

original: snod dkar po byas te zhes pa ni 'bras btags pa'i snod dkar po byas te /
analyzed: snod dkar po byas te zhes pa ni 'bras btags pa'i snod dkar po byas te /
translated: The line one should make a white vessel means that one should make a white vessel of dough.

original: der ni ri skegs gnyis gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: der ni ri skegs gnyis gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In that, one should place the two parrots.🔽 The line one should place it on the charcoal of a burnt corpse means

original: ro bsregs pa'i sol ba la gzhag par bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ro bsregs pa'i sol ba la gzhag par bya zhes pa ni /
translated: that one should place the vessel on the charcoal of a burnt corpse.

original: snod der ri skegs dang bcas pa'i ro bsregs pa'i sol ba la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: snod der ri skegs dang bcas pa'i ro bsregs pa'i sol ba la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In that vessel, together with the myrobalan, one should place the ashes of the cremation.

original: ro bsregs pa'i sol ba las snag tsha byas te /
analyzed: ro bsregs pa'i sol ba las snag tsha byas te /
translated: Having made ink from the ashes of the cremation,

original: dben par sngags bri zhes pa ni ka ra p'i ra dkar po'i smyu gus gro ga'i 'dab ma la ro bsregs pa'i thal ba dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags bri bar bya zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dben par sngags bri zhes pa ni ka ra p'i ra dkar po'i smyu gus gro ga'i 'dab ma la ro bsregs pa'i thal ba dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags bri bar bya zhes sbyar ro //
translated: one should write the mantra in a secluded place.

original: sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngags gsungs pa /
translated: The mantra is stated:

original: aom buddha ka p'a li zhes pa la sogs pa sam skri ta dang / phal pa bsres pa'i sngags mu ra dh'a pra na dza ai'i mthar thug par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom buddha ka p'a li zhes pa la sogs pa sam skri ta dang / phal pa bsres pa'i sngags mu ra dh'a pra na dza ai'i mthar thug par bri bar bya'o //
translated: Oṃ buddhakapāli, etc., up to samskṛta and phalapūrita. The mantra mixed with the ashes of the cremation should be written.

original: ri skegs kyi snying po'i sngags zhes pa ni ri skegs byas pa'i snying gar sngags 'di bris te gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ri skegs kyi snying po'i sngags zhes pa ni ri skegs byas pa'i snying gar sngags 'di bris te gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The mantra of the essence of the myrobalan means that this mantra should be written in the heart of the myrobalan and inserted.

original: yongs rdzogs sha li ka byas pas //
analyzed: yongs rdzogs sha li ka byas pas //
translated: Having made the complete śāli,

original: zhes pa ni sngags yongs su rdzogs pa'i ri skegs bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags yongs su rdzogs pa'i ri skegs bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: this means that the myrobalan should be made complete with the mantra.

original: pho dang mor ni brtag par bya //
analyzed: pho dang mor ni brtag par bya //
translated: One should examine the male and female.

original: zhes pa ni 'di ni pho'i 'di ni mo'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya zhes pa'i tha @127b tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'di ni pho'i 'di ni mo'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya zhes pa'i tha @127b tshig go //
translated: This is the conclusion: “This is the male, this is the female.”

original: snag tsha yis ni bri bar bya //
analyzed: snag tsha yis ni bri bar bya //
translated: One should write with ink.

original: zhes pa ni snag tshas ri skegs kyi gzugs brnyan la ri mo bri zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snag tshas ri skegs kyi gzugs brnyan la ri mo bri zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the conclusion: “One should draw a picture of the mynah bird with ink.”

original: mig gi mngon du mi gzhag cing //
analyzed: mig gi mngon du mi gzhag cing //
translated: One should not place the eyes in front.

original: zhes pa ni ri skegs kyi gzugs mdun du gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ri skegs kyi gzugs mdun du gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: This is the conclusion: “One should not place the form of the mynah bird in front.”

original: gang du gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: Where should one place it?

original: rgyab tu gzhag par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyab tu gzhag par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the conclusion: “One should place it behind.”

original: de nas lcug ma sngags kyis mngag / ces pa ni ka ra p'i ra dkar po'i lcug mas mngag cing rbad par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nas lcug ma sngags kyis mngag / ces pa ni ka ra p'i ra dkar po'i lcug mas mngag cing rbad par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Then, one should dispatch with the mantra of the twig. This is the conclusion: “One should dispatch and send forth with a twig of white karavīra.”

original: mngag pa'i sngags gsungs pa /🔽aom ham ha zhes pa ni khyab 'jug gi sa bon zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mngag pa'i sngags gsungs pa / aom ham ha zhes pa ni khyab 'jug gi sa bon zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The mantra for dispatching is stated:🔽Oṃ haṃ ha. This means “the seed of Viṣṇu.”

original: aom bam zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i sa bon zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom bam zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i sa bon zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Oṃ vaṃ. This means “the seed of Brahmā.”

original: aom sam zhes pa ni zhi byed kyi sa bon zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom sam zhes pa ni zhi byed kyi sa bon zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Om sam is the seed of the pacifying.

original: sngags 'di ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sngags 'di ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: This mantra is the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar yang gsang ba'i mdzod las /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsang ba'i mdzod las /
translated: Thus, in the Secret Treasury:

original: khyab 'jug sems su gsungs pa ste //
analyzed: khyab 'jug sems su gsungs pa ste //
translated: Viṣṇu is said to be the mind,

original: dbang phyug 'dod pa ru ni grags //
analyzed: dbang phyug 'dod pa ru ni grags //
translated: Śiva is known as desire,

original: tshangs pa thar par gsungs pa ste //🔽'di dag 'jig rten gsum du bshad //
analyzed: tshangs pa thar par gsungs pa ste // 'di dag 'jig rten gsum du bshad //
translated: Brahmā is said to be liberation,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: these are explained in the three worlds.

original: aom ha ha he he ho ho ham sam sv'a h'a /🔽'di lta bu yi sngags kyi mchog //
analyzed: aom ha ha he he ho ho ham sam sv'a h'a / 'di lta bu yi sngags kyi mchog //
translated: Om ha ha he he ho ho ham sam svāhā.🔽This kind of mantra is supreme.

original: ces pa sngags 'di lta bu ni mchog yin pa'o //🔽stong gsum na yang rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: ces pa sngags 'di lta bu ni mchog yin pa'o // stong gsum na yang rnyed par dka' //
translated: This kind of mantra is supreme.🔽Hard to find even in the three-thousandfold world systems.

original: zhes pa ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po rnams su yang rnyed par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po rnams su yang rnyed par dka' ba ste /
translated: This means hard to find in the great trichiliocosm,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnyed par dgongs so //🔽lan bdun mngag pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnyed par dgongs so // lan bdun mngag pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: thinking of the suffering of finding it.🔽By merely summoning seven times,

original: zhes pa ni lan bdun du sngags bton pa tsam gyis de 'gugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lan bdun du sngags bton pa tsam gyis de 'gugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: by merely reciting the mantra seven times, it will be summoned.

original: 'gro ba 'dir ni the tshom med //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dir ni the tshom med //
translated: There is no doubt about this for beings here.

original: ces pa ni ri skegs 'di dag klu'i gnas su 'gro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces pa ni ri skegs 'di dag klu'i gnas su 'gro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with these parrots go to the abode of the nāgas.

original: mkha' lding bye ba'i stobs dang ldan //
analyzed: mkha' lding bye ba'i stobs dang ldan //
translated: Possessing the strength of ten million garuḍas

original: zhes pa ni de dag mthong nas klu thams cad kun du skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de dag mthong nas klu thams cad kun du skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: means that all nāgas become terrified upon seeing them.

original: mi 'dzin pa'i sprul gang gis ri skegs mthong ba tsam gyis long bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa'i sprul gang gis ri skegs mthong ba tsam gyis long bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the mere sight of the parrot, the nāga is blinded.

original: ri skegs kyi sprul long ba bzung nas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri skegs kyi sprul long ba bzung nas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seized the blind parrot, it will come.

original: sprul long ba de slob dpon gyis mthong nas ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: sprul long ba de slob dpon gyis mthong nas ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: Seeing the blind nāga, what should the master do?

original: sprul long ba la bsnun zhes pa ni sprul long ba de las dang mngag pa'i sngags kyis bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: sprul long ba la bsnun zhes pa ni sprul long ba de las dang mngag pa'i sngags kyis bsnun par bya'o //
translated: Strike the blind nāga means that blind nāga should be struck with the mantra of action and command.

original: bsnun pa tsam gyis mig dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽sprul gyis zin @128a * //
analyzed: bsnun pa tsam gyis mig dang ldan par 'gyur ro // sprul gyis zin @128a * //
translated: By merely striking it, it will regain its sight.

original: pa shi par mthong nas de'i lus la lan gsum du 'gro zhing 'ong bar byed de /
analyzed: pa shi par mthong nas de'i lus la lan gsum du 'gro zhing 'ong bar byed de /
translated: Seeing the dead one seized by the nāga, it goes and comes three times to its body.

original: zin pa dug med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zin pa dug med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The seized one becomes free from poison.

original: dug 'phrog pa'i stong pa nyid kyi tshigs bcad gsungs pa /
analyzed: dug 'phrog pa'i stong pa nyid kyi tshigs bcad gsungs pa /
translated: The verse on the emptiness that removes poison.

original: stong pa dri med ces pa ni gang zhig dri ma dang bral ba de ni stong pa nyid dri ma med pa ste de nyid stong pa dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa dri med ces pa ni gang zhig dri ma dang bral ba de ni stong pa nyid dri ma med pa ste de nyid stong pa dri ma med pa'o //
translated: The stainless emptiness is that which is free from stains. That is the stainless emptiness.

original: kun rang bzhin zhes pa ni mtha' dag gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces pa'i tha tshig go //🔽chos rnams stong pa'i rang bzhin kye //
analyzed: kun rang bzhin zhes pa ni mtha' dag gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces pa'i tha tshig go // chos rnams stong pa'i rang bzhin kye //
translated: The nature of all is the nature of emptiness.

original: zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The nature of all phenomena is emptiness.

original: gang gis 'dzin cing zhes pa ni 'dir chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na su 'dzin te su yang mi 'dzin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin cing zhes pa ni 'dir chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na su 'dzin te su yang mi 'dzin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By whom is it grasped? Here, if all phenomena are emptiness, by whom is it grasped? By no one at all.

original: gang zhig 'dzin te zhes pa ni gang yang mi 'dzin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dzin te zhes pa ni gang yang mi 'dzin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By whom is it grasped? By no one at all.

original: mtha' dag sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni dngos po mtha' dag sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtha' dag sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni dngos po mtha' dag sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nature of all is illusory. The nature of all things is illusory.

original: dngos po mtha' dag stong pa zhes pa ni khams gsum pa mtha' dag stong pa dang / dngos po mtha' dag stong pa nyid las chos thams cad stong pa nyid la dug gi skabs ga la yod ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag stong pa zhes pa ni khams gsum pa mtha' dag stong pa dang / dngos po mtha' dag stong pa nyid las chos thams cad stong pa nyid la dug gi skabs ga la yod ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: All things are empty means that the entire three realms are empty, and from all things being empty, how can there be any occasion for poison in the emptiness of all phenomena?

original: sangs rgyas thod pa'i rgyud ces bshad zin to /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thod pa'i rgyud ces bshad zin to /
translated: The Buddha Skull Tantra has already been explained.

original: // / nyi shu rtsa gcig ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: // / nyi shu rtsa gcig ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The twenty-one [syllable mantra] and so forth are easy to understand.

original: slob dpon gyis yang dag par brtson par bya'o zhes pa ni slob dpon gyis dug gis zin pa mthong nas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin yang dag par brtsams te bsgom zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis yang dag par brtson par bya'o zhes pa ni slob dpon gyis dug gis zin pa mthong nas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin yang dag par brtsams te bsgom zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The master should apply himself properly means that when the master sees someone bitten by a snake, he should apply himself properly to the meditative concentration of emptiness and meditate.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni slob ma dbang bskur ba'i 'og tu rjes su gnang ba la sogs pa sbyin par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni slob ma dbang bskur ba'i 'og tu rjes su gnang ba la sogs pa sbyin par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus means that after the disciple has been initiated, he should be given permission and so forth.

original: aom buddha ka p'a li zhes pa la sogs pa ni dug bza' bar bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: aom buddha ka p'a li zhes pa la sogs pa ni dug bza' bar bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Oṃ buddha kapāli and so forth means that one should eat the poison.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //🔽aom buddha ka p'a li zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o // aom buddha ka p'a li zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Then, etc. is easy to understand.

original: dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba'i sngags te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba'i sngags te /
translated: Oṃ buddhakapālī, etc. is the mantra for requesting the maṇḍala to depart.

original: lag pa sa la bzhag nas sngags 'dis dug gi dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol lo //🔽de nas yang dag rab bshad bya //
analyzed: lag pa sa la bzhag nas sngags 'dis dug gi dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol lo // de nas yang dag rab bshad bya //
translated: Placing one’s hand on the ground, one should request the maṇḍala of poison to depart with this mantra.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Then, I will explain the perfect, etc. is easy to understand.

original: gnas dgu rnams su mchod par bya //
analyzed: gnas dgu rnams su mchod par bya //
translated: One should make offerings in the nine places.

original: zhes pa ni he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi @128b dgu'i bdag nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa ni he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi @128b dgu'i bdag nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: This is said to be the nature of the ground of the maṇḍala of Heruka,

original: rdul tshon gyis bris la mchod par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdul tshon gyis bris la mchod par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is drawn with colored powders and to which one should make offerings.

original: dung phor chu yis zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dung phor chu yis zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The water in the conch shell, etc. is easy to understand.

original: rang gi lag pa g-yon pa la //
analyzed: rang gi lag pa g-yon pa la //
translated: On one’s left hand

original: zla ba yis ni khyab par bsam //
analyzed: zla ba yis ni khyab par bsam //
translated: one should imagine the moon.

original: zhes pa ni rang gi lag pa g-yon pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi lag pa g-yon pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means one should meditate on a moon maṇḍala on one’s left hand.

original: bcu drug cha la yongs rdzogs pa'i //
analyzed: bcu drug cha la yongs rdzogs pa'i //
translated: The sixteen parts are completely perfect.

original: zhes pa ni cha drug ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni cha drug ste /
translated: This is the six parts.

original: dbyangs yig bcu drug khyab par yongs su rdzogs pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbyangs yig bcu drug khyab par yongs su rdzogs pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that one should meditate on the moon disk, which is completely filled with the sixteen vowels.

original: dri med dge ba'i lus can te //
analyzed: dri med dge ba'i lus can te //
translated: It has a body of stainless virtue.

original: zhes pa ni dri ma med cing dkar ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lus te gzugs bsgom zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dri ma med cing dkar ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lus te gzugs bsgom zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that one should meditate on the form of the moon disk, which is stainless and white.🔽In its center is the indestructible, virtuous.

original: de'i dbus su mi shigs dge / zhes pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i dbus su mi shigs pa'i ham mgo dang bral ba dge ba'i mchog bsam zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i dbus su mi shigs dge / zhes pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i dbus su mi shigs pa'i ham mgo dang bral ba dge ba'i mchog bsam zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that one should meditate on the supreme virtue, the indestructible, which is free from the head and the haṃ.🔽It has a body of white color.

original: kha dog dkar po'i lus can zhes pa ni mi shigs pa kha dog dkar po lus lag pa g-yon pa la bsgom zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kha dog dkar po'i lus can zhes pa ni mi shigs pa kha dog dkar po lus lag pa g-yon pa la bsgom zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that one should meditate on the indestructible, which is white in color, on the left hand.🔽With that hand one should cover the mouth of the vessel.

original: lag pa des snod kyi kha mnan te zhes pa ni chu snod kyi bar nas chu blangs te /
analyzed: lag pa des snod kyi kha mnan te zhes pa ni chu snod kyi bar nas chu blangs te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that one should take water from between the water vessels,

original: lag pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms nas /
analyzed: lag pa la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms nas /
translated: meditate on the moon disk on the hand,

original: de'i kha mnan te /
analyzed: de'i kha mnan te /
translated: and cover its mouth.

original: aom sarba ba sha ha re zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags bzla zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom sarba ba sha ha re zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags bzla zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should recite the mantra “Oṃ sarva-vaśa-hare” and so forth.

original: mi shigs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: mi shigs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: “Unbreakable” and so on is easy to understand.

original: sangs rgyas thod pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thod pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to /
translated: “Buddha Skull” and so on has been explained.

original: // /'o'i sgra ni le'u rdzogs pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: // /'o'i sgra ni le'u rdzogs pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word “then” is a word for completing the chapter.

original: gang zhe na sangs rgyas thod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na sangs rgyas thod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: What? “Buddha Skull” and so on.
